title: 8. Gender-Related Biaded in the Type and Motif Indexed of Aarne and Thompdon

items.abstract: <jats:p>In the mid-1960's a group of Benedictine monks at Saint John's Abbey and University in central Minnesota faced a challenge. They were wondering what could be done to preserve the precious hand-written religious books located in European monasteries and libraries. The devastation of World War II was a recent memory, and the potential loss of cultural material in the event of the Cold War suddenly turning “hot” was difficult to imagine. The monks had two goals: the preservation of the manuscript's contents and the creation of a means for scholars to easily access them. The task was daunting – thousands of manuscripts existed in dozens of Western European locations.</jats:p>
title: Manuscript Digitization at the Hill Museum & Manuscript Library: Building on the Legacy of Microfilm
